required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Combination Saxagliptin & Dapagliflozin Added to Metformin to Treat Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Active Controlled, Parallel Group, Phase 3 Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Add-On Therapy With Saxagliptin and Dapagliflozin Added to Metformin Compared to Add-On Therapy With Saxagliptin in Combination With Metformin or Dapagliflozin in Combination With Metformin in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Who Have Inadequate Glycemic Control on Metformin Alone.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to learn if a combination of BMS-477118 (Saxagliptin) and BMS -512148 (Dapagliflozin) added to Metformin can improve (decrease) Glycosylated Hemoglobin (Hemoglobin A1c) in patients with type 2 diabetes after 24 weeks of treatment. The safety of this treatment will also be studied.

primary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1C (HbA1c) at Week 24
primary_outcome.description: HbA1c was measured as percent of hemoglobin by a central laboratory. Baseline was defined as the last assessment on or prior to the date of the first dose of the double-blind study medication. HbA1c measurements were obtained at Week 24 in the double-blind period, including observations prior to rescue.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in 2-hour Post Prandial Glucose (PPG) From a Liquid Meal Tolerance Test (MTT) at Week 24 (Last Observation Carried Forward [LOCF])
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline was defined as the last assessment on or prior to the date of the first dose of the double-blind study medication. PPG measurements were obtained at week 24 in the doubleblind period, including observations prior to rescue.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline was defined as the last assessment on or prior to the date of the first dose of the double-blind study medication. FPG measurements were obtained at Week 24 in the doubleblind period, including observations prior to rescue.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Percentage of Participants Achieving a Therapeutic Glycemic Response (Hemoglobin A1c [HbA1C]) <7.0% at Week 24 (Last Observation Carried Forward [LOCF])
secondary_outcome.description: Therapeutic glycemic response is defined as HbA1c <7.0%. Data after rescue medication was excluded from this analysis. HbA1c was measured as a percent of hemoglobin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Body Weight at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline was defined as the last assessment on or prior to the date of the first dose of the double-blind study medication. Body weight measurements were obtained at Week 24 in the doubleblind period, including observations prior to rescue.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with Type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) with HbA1c ≥ 8.0% and ≤ 12.0%
- Stable metformin therapy dose of ≥ 1500mg for at least 8 weeks prior to screening
- Body mass index (BMI) ≤ 45.0kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) < 60mL/min/1,73m2 and Serum Creatinine (Scr) ≥ 1.5 mg/dL in males or ≥ 1.4 mg/dL in females
- Uncontrolled hypertension Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) ≥ 160mmHg and/or Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) ≥ 100mmHg
- Hepatic disease
- Cardiovascular disease within 3 months

facility.name: Center For Clinical Trials Of Sacramento, Inc.
Horizon Research Group Of Opelousas, Llc
Central Jersey Health And Medical Research
Hampton Roads Center For Clinical Research, Inc.

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link: http://www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

results_reference.citation: Rosenstock J, Hansen L, Zee P, Li Y, Cook W, Hirshberg B, Iqbal N. Dual add-on therapy in type 2 diabetes poorly controlled with metformin monotherapy: a randomized double-blind trial of saxagliptin plus dapagliflozin addition versus single addition of saxagliptin or dapagliflozin to metformin. Diabetes Care. 2015 Mar;38(3):376-83. doi: 10.2337/dc14-1142. Epub 2014 Oct 28.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of 1282 participants enrolled subjects, 534 eligible subjects entered the randomized, double-blind treatment period. Of 534 randomized and treated subjects, 490 subjects completed the study.

group.title: Arm 1: Saxagliptin+Metformin XR+Placebo
group.description: Drug: Saxagliptin Tablets, Oral, 5mg , Once daily, 24 weeks Other Names: Onglyza Drug: Metformin XR Tablets, Oral, ≥ 1500mg/≤ 2000mg, Once daily, 24 weeks Other Names: Glucophage XR Drug: Placebo matching with Dapagliflozin Tablets, Oral, 0mg, Once daily, 24 weeks

group.title: Arm 2: Dapagliflozin+Metformin XR+Placebo
group.description: Drug: Metformin XR Tablets, Oral, ≥ 1500mg/≤ 2000mg, Once daily, 24 weeks Other Names: Glucophage XR Drug: Dapagliflozin Tablets, Oral, 10mg , Once daily, 24 weeks Other Names: BMS512148 Drug: Placebo matching with Saxagliptin Tablets, Oral, 0mg, Once daily, 24 weeks

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1C (HbA1c) at Week 24
outcome.description: HbA1c was measured as percent of hemoglobin by a central laboratory. Baseline was defined as the last assessment on or prior to the date of the first dose of the double-blind study medication. HbA1c measurements were obtained at Week 24 in the double-blind period, including observations prior to rescue.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received study medication and had nonmissing HbA1c values at baseline and Week 24

measure.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1C (HbA1c) at Week 24
measure.description: HbA1c was measured as percent of hemoglobin by a central laboratory. Baseline was defined as the last assessment on or prior to the date of the first dose of the double-blind study medication. HbA1c measurements were obtained at Week 24 in the double-blind period, including observations prior to rescue.
measure.population: All randomized participants who received study medication and had nonmissing HbA1c values at baseline and Week 24

analysis.p_value_desc: Primary endpoint was tested at alpha=0.05; significance was claimed only if Saxagliptin+Dapagliflozin+Metformin was superior to both Saxagliptin+Metformin and Dapagliflozin+Metformin.
Primary endpoint was tested at alpha=0.05; significance was claimed only if Saxagliptin+Dapagliflozin+Metformin was superior to both Saxagliptin+Metformin and Dapagliflozin+Metformin.

outcome.description: Baseline was defined as the last assessment on or prior to the date of the first dose of the double-blind study medication. PPG measurements were obtained at week 24 in the doubleblind period, including observations prior to rescue.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received study medication and had nonmissing PPG values at baseline and Week 24 (LOCF)

analysis.p_value_desc: Each secondary endpoint was tested at alpha=0.05; significance was claimed only if Saxagliptin+Dapagliflozin+Metformin was superior to both Saxagliptin+Metformin and Dapagliflozin+Metformin.
Each secondary endpoint was tested at alpha=0.05; significance testing stops at the endpoint where p-value>0.05.

outcome.population: All randomized participants who received study medication and had nonmissing PPG values at baseline and Week 24

analysis.estimate_desc: ANCOVA was applied for comparison, but p-value was not reported because at least one prior test in the hierarchical testing procedure yielded p-value>0.05.
ANCOVA was applied for comparison, but p-value was not reported because at least one prior test in the hierarchical testing procedure yielded p-value>0.05.

outcome.title: Adjusted Percentage of Participants Achieving a Therapeutic Glycemic Response (Hemoglobin A1c [HbA1C]) <7.0% at Week 24 (Last Observation Carried Forward [LOCF])
outcome.description: Therapeutic glycemic response is defined as HbA1c <7.0%. Data after rescue medication was excluded from this analysis. HbA1c was measured as a percent of hemoglobin.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received study medication and were not missing baseline and Week 24 (LOCF) values

measure.title: Adjusted Percentage of Participants Achieving a Therapeutic Glycemic Response (Hemoglobin A1c [HbA1C]) <7.0% at Week 24 (Last Observation Carried Forward [LOCF])
measure.description: Therapeutic glycemic response is defined as HbA1c <7.0%. Data after rescue medication was excluded from this analysis. HbA1c was measured as a percent of hemoglobin.
measure.population: All randomized participants who received study medication and were not missing baseline and Week 24 (LOCF) values

analysis.estimate_desc: Modified Logistic Regression was applied for comparison, but p-value was not reported because at least one prior test in the hierarchical testing procedure yielded p-value>0.05.
Modified Logistic Regression was applied for comparison, but p-value was not reported because at least one prior test in the hierarchical testing procedure yielded p-value>0.05.

outcome.population: All randomized participants who received study medication and had nonmissing body weight values at baseline and Week 24

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
